text:
When restarting the Apach2 service (through a normal "net stop" and "net 
start" or the service manager or the ApacheMonitor service tray) an 
application error dialog opens saying the following:

====
The instruction at "0x77f69ecd" referenced memory at "0x00000010". The memory 
could not be "written".

Click OK to terminate the program
Click CANCEL to debug the program
====

If you click OK or CANCEL, the dialog just reopens - infinitly.  You need to 
reboot your machine to get rid of it!

Apache DOES restart though....

I am running mod_jk2.04 (part of the jakarta project) with Tomcat 5.0.24 
behind it.  Not sure if its the shared memory between tomcat and apache?

Any feedback would be great as this is most annoying!

Thanks!
creator: carl@zero-one.co.za
chip@force-elite.com
text: can you isolate if this problem only happens when mod_jk is loaded?

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text: No response from submittor, presuming a (fixed) jk issue.
